txt.en: 'If the Necromancer is so powerful, how can he not know we are here?'
'Then may the room remain crowded, and the whisper silent!'
'Hold a moment, Raddir.'
'We have done well to come this far, but I must go the rest of the way alone.'
'My dear Raddir! Did you think I questioned your bravery earlier? I did not.'
'I do not yet know what this Necromancer is, but I have my suspicions.'
'Mithrandir...where are you...?'
'If any of them be true, even Gandalf the Grey would be a fool to face him in his fortress.'
'Something is wrong...why has he been gone so long?'
'I go to find out. Stay here, my friend. I will have need of you on my return.'
You hear footsteps behind you, and some familiar faces arrive!
'Should I go up after him? He told me not to do so, but....'
'Mithrandir!'
'What happened to your staff?'
'What happened up there, Mithrandir?'
'There are shouts up above. We have to leave, Mithrandir!'

'I can hardly believe it, but this passage is exactly what we need in order to launch our final assault upon Dol Guldur! We will surprise them from below and be within the walls of the fortress before our foes know they are under attack!\n\n'We will return here with a sizeable company and launch our final assault!'
'Are you ready to leave? We will return to Thangúlhad and make ready for the final battle. This secret way into the fortress gives me hope...our victory is all but assured!'
'It is my guess that they are outcasts.'
You have found a cavern carved deep beneath the fortress of Dol Guldur. Could this be the same passage Gandalf used to infiltrate the fastness of the Necromancer long ago?
'No, do not look surprised! They are still our enemies.'
'These are they for whom the Necromancer has little use, for whatever reason.'
'And so it is they collect in the detritus beneath his fortress, beneath his notice.'
'I did not conceal the danger from you, Raddir.'
'It is my hope we will be the same.'
'Did you believe this journey to the fortress of the Necromancer would be easy?'
'I would have sought another guide had I known this to be true!'
'It was well-spoken, Raddir, but there are things that need finding-out.'
'That is the way of such evil.'
'I have never been to a place like this. Already its presence corrupts the woods around.'
'If it is not checked, it will spread outward in all directions, corrupting good lands and people.'
'I will stand against the evil. I am not afraid!'
'We have arrived, my friend, but now that we are here, I wish we were not!'
'It was spoken in jest, Mithrandir. Well...mostly in jest.'
'In truth, who could wish to be in this forsaken place?'
'Then I hope we find them out and emerge from these caverns the better for it!'
Clear Thurimen, the cavern beneath the foundations of Dol Guldur, of foes
Proceed further into Thurimen, clearing it of foes
Proceed further into Thurimen, clearing it of foes
'This is just what we have been seeking!'
Talk to Bróin
'But why? Have I not proven myself a staunch companion?'
'I cannot let you face the Necromancer on your own!'
'But how can that be? How can the Necromancer wield such power?'
You have found a cavern beneath Dol Guldur and must clear it of foes if it is to be used by the Golden Host.
'There is something different about the foes we have faced in this cavern.'
You have cleared much of Thurimen of threats and should proceed onward and upwards.
'I cannot quite decide what it might be.'
You have cleared much of Thurimen of threats and should proceed onward and upwards.
Bróin and Sigileth have come to Thurimen and are amazed to see how well it suits their purposes.
'It is true that, were he looking for them, there are signs that might reveal us to him.'
'As long as I refrain from any display of power, he should not be aware of our presence.'
'His own wicked sorceries serve to hide us from him, like a whisper in a crowded room.'
Hazy images of the past unfold before you...

'So this is the secret way Mithrandir used to enter the fortress of the Necromancer. Raddir would not speak of it in any great detail, even to his friends. The experience left him greatly changed, and he was slower to laugh and to sing than he had been.\n\n'Raddir too will be avenged when we launch the final assault upon the fortress. It lies directly above us here, and our foes do not know their danger.'
'I had to leave it behind. There is little time!'
'We cannot...cannot rest. I almost...did not get away.'
'Thráin is dead. He did not know his name at the end, but it can only have been he.'
'The dwarf-ring, last of the Seven, had been taken from him.'
'Listen to me, Raddir!'
'The Necromancer is Sauron.'
'He has returned.'
Instance: Memories of Mithrandir
